title: Your Name
description: Create a variable called `name` with your name and log it
starterCode: // create a variable and print it
testCode: (async function(){ try{ if(typeof name === 'undefined') return false; const n = String(name); return consoleMessages.some(m => m.includes(n)); }catch(e){ return false } })
hint: Create a variable `name` with your name, for example: const name = 'YourName'; console.log(name)

title: Add Numbers
description: Create two variables with numbers and log their sum (e.g. 3 + 4 -> 7)
starterCode: // create two variables and console.log their sum
testCode: (async function(){ try{ return consoleMessages.some(m => { const n = parseFloat(String(m).trim()); return !isNaN(n) && n > 0; }); }catch(e){return false} })
hint: const a = 3; const b = 4; console.log(a + b) — you can use var, let or const

title: Full Name
description: Create `first` and `last` variables and log the full name (e.g. Alex Doe)
starterCode: // create two string variables and join them
testCode: (async function(){ try{ return consoleMessages.some(m => { const parts = String(m).trim().split(/\s+/); return parts.length >= 2; }); }catch(e){return false} })
hint: const first = 'Alex'; const last = 'Doe'; console.log(first + ' ' + last) — you can use var, let or const

title: Change a Variable
description: Start with `let count = 1` then increase it and log the new value (should be 2)
starterCode:
let count = 1;
// increase count and log it
testCode: (async function(){ try{ return consoleMessages.some(m => { const n = parseFloat(String(m).trim()); return !isNaN(n) && n===2; }); }catch(e){return false} })
hint: count = count + 1; console.log(count) — declare with var, let or const as you prefer

starterCode:

hint: if (age >= 18) { console.log('adult') } else { console.log('minor') } — case does not matter

title: Equality Check
description: Given `const password = 'open'`, log 'welcome' when it matches
starterCode:
const password = 'open';
// check password and log accordingly
hint: if (password === 'open') { console.log('welcome') } else { console.log('denied') } — equality check is strict, you can use var/let/const
